docs.summary: Event that is fired when a specific action is performed on the React element.
description: If you pass an event handler to your code in the React Component's [`props`](reactcomponent/props), you can access the `ReactEvent`'s payload. The event's payload includes the [`context`](/context) in which an event was fired, and the React component's [`wixTarget`](/wixtarget) ($w element) that the event was fired on.

docs.summary: Gets the context in which an event was fired.
description: An event's `context` contains information about the circumstances
surrounding the firing of the event.
The context property only appears in events on repeated elements.
You can use the event context with [`$w.at()`]($w.html#at) to get a
selector function which selects items from a specific repeater item.
It contains an object with one key:value pair. The key is "itemId" and
the value is the ID of the repeated item on which the event occurred.
